p: Targeting the host process during viral infection figures as a promising alternative for drug development and can play an important role in abrogating viral replication ( Sayce et al., 2010; Ullah et al., 2019). Nitazoxanide is a broad-spectrum antiviral agent exploited for the treatment of, for instance, influenza A and B viruses, as well as Ebola virus (EBOV) ( Rossignol, 2014; Jasenosky et al., 2019), with its activity related to the interference in host-regulated pathways during viral replication ( Rossignol, 2016). In vitro studies demonstrated that Nitazoxanide was able to inhibit MERS-CoV in LLC-MK2 cells, with an EC 50 of 0.92 μg mL –1. The authors suggested that nitazoxanide affects pro-inflammatory cytokines and suppresses their overproduction ( Rossignol, 2016).
